salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps: For the chicken, make an incision to the chicken breast lengthways to create a pocket.
Place the Stilton into the pocket then wrap the breast with the bacon rashers.
Rub the bacon-wrapped breast with the olive oil and season both sides with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Heat an ovenproof frying pan over a high heat. Add the bacon-wrapped chicken and pan fry for one minute on each side until browned.
Transfer to the oven and roast for 12-15 minutes, or until the chicken is completely cooked through.
To make the mash, mash the cooked butternut squash using a potato masher or a ricer.
Add the cream and Stilton, mix together well and season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
To serve, place the mashed butternut squash in the middle of a large warmed plate and place the chicken on top.
title: Pan-fried bacon-wrapped chicken breast with cheesy butternut squash mash
